article.headline: Pace of French industrial output slows in August
article.body: French industrial production increased on month in August, but at a much slower pace than in previous months, data from France's statistics agency Insee showed Friday. Total industrial output--comprising output in manufacturing, energy and construction--rose 1.3% in August from July, following a 3.8% increase in the previous month. Economists had forecast a 2.1% increase in August, according to a poll by The Wall Street Journal. Compared with February, the last month before the coronavirus pandemic hit Europe, total industrial output was down 6.3% in August in calendar-adjusted terms. Manufacturing output--excluding energy and construction--was up 1.0% in August compared with July, while energy production increased 2.8% and construction rose 4.9%. Write to Maria Martinez at maria.martinez@wsj.com
